channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Pothole, 8th January
item.description:
Good afternoon, a pothole has reformed on the right hand side of the road as you head towards Imjin Barracks from Hare and Hounds.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 325 Innsworth Lane, Gloucester
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Loose flags and broken flags, 8th January
item.description:
Can somebody check it out and replace them please?

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 22 Montpellier Walk, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Wrong road marking!!!! needs to be solid line, 8th January
item.description:
On this section of the road after the Kilkeney In as you go towards Gloucester the road markings are wrong, it should not be interrupted line but a continuous solid line as there is no visibility and it is dangerous to overtake. Once I was driving relaxed towards Gloucester in the evening and suddenly when I reached this curve someone from opposite direction engaged in overtaking and appeared straight in front of me. Luckily he managed to get partly back into his lane and I managed to go over the roadside grass and we avoided front head on collision. So the other party relied that the road markings interrupted line are accurate and safe and he used them as guidance, but he did not realise because there is no visibility on this section the road the markings are wrong and needs updating URGENTLY to solid line PLEASE. Thank you!!! The purpose of the road markings and the road signs are to ensure the traffic and the road users are safe if they respect them, but needs to be accurate and realistic.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): A436, Andoversford
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Surface water flooding, 8th January
item.description:
This section of road is suffering from surface water flooding; creating a significant hazard for vehicles and cycles. Suspected blocked road drain. Opposite Evington Hill Farm.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Evington Hill Farm A38, The Leigh
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Blocked road drain, 8th January
item.description:
Blocked road drain causing flooding on road. This has been blocked for several months. It causes an obstruction to the highway and also a nuisance for pedestrians who can get soaked by passing vehicles.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Guard House Down Hatherley Lane, Gloucester
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Puddle - Risk of aquaplaning, 7th January
item.description:
When heading towards Cheltenham. The grass under the central reservation barrier ends for a few yards befor starting again, here a stream of water runs across the road. This is located between the layby and the slip road which goes down to the M5. There's a high risk of aquaplaning as a result.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): A40, Staverton
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Defective surfacing/projecting ironwork, 7th January
item.description:
The surfacing is breaking up, leaving ironwork exposed. Potential for danger to bicyclists and damage to motor tyres.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 199 Old Bath Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Inspection cover still defective, 7th January
item.description:
Inspection cover sinking and surrounding surfacing crumbling. This was reported in May and August 2022: why no action?
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 201 Old Bath Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Time to replace felled trees, 7th January
item.description:
You felled a fine old tree (lime?) here several years ago. It has not been replaced: why not? At least two others of this wonderful avenue have recently been felled. Is this because they were diseased? Replacements need to be promptly planted, so that the avenue will survive in the long term.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 224 Leckhampton Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Blocked drains in road., 7th January
item.description:
The drain on Mill Lane, just after the property called Dormans on the left is totally block, and water is running all along the road. I reported the job directly to the council, I received an email last week saying the job had been closed, But the job / issue has not been fixed. Please can it be fixed asap, and it should be flagged that a job has been closed when not fixed.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Dormans Mill Lane, Prestbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large pothole at least 10cm deep and down to road-stone below. Breaking up and leaving rubble in the road. Drains not funtioning, so area has standing water whenever it rains., 7th January
item.description:
Drains not at the lowest point so there is standing water for days on end, this has caused the road surface to break up and horn a large pothole. The hole is now breaking up and leaving rubble on the road which can fly up an is a serious hazard. Outside 163 Hewlett road.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Teme Place Teme Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
